job.title: Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician (33502)
job.description:
Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician
Magnolia, Arkansas (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $32.07 /hr. - $51.29 /hr.

Summary: Seeking a full-time Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician responsible for operation and maintenance (O&M) of remediation systems at a former industrial site. The successful candidate shall perform office and field tasks necessary to operate and maintain groundwater collection and treatment systems. Field tasks include inspections, sample collection, preventative maintenance and repair, grounds keeping (e.g., mowing, weed eating, herbicide application, and painting), and subcontractor oversight. Office tasks include monitoring operational data and reporting.

Responsibilities:
  • Performs a variety of tasks in the operation and maintenance of water collection and treatment systems including maintenance of equipment, quality control/testing and day-to-day activities on an assigned shift.
  • Operates collection and treatment facilities to control flow and processing of water.
  • Monitors gauges, meters, and control panels.
  • Observes variations in operating conditions and interprets meter and gauge readings.
  • Operates valves either manually or by remote control.
  • Starts and stops pump, motors, and generators to control and adjust the flow of treatment processes.
  • Conducts and documents the results of inspections activities.
  • Performs routine maintenance functions, groundskeeping, and custodial duties.
  • Performs and oversees field tasks with minimal supervision and makes operating decisions in absence of supervisory personnel.
  • Understands and carries out oral and written directions.
  • Conducts routine setup, assembly, installation, and minor troubleshooting or repair of remediation equipment.
  • Acts as onsite lead for maintaining compliance with permit conditions.
  • Completes clear and detailed field documentation, including daily and weekly reports, photographic logs, inspection sheets, and preventative maintenance records.
  • Performs waste management activities including inspection of waste accumulation areas, tracking waste inventories, and overseeing waste pickups.
Qualifications:
  • Basic familiarity with operating principles of valves, pumps, and motors; water/wastewater treatment processes; and associated safe work practices.
  • High school diploma or GED.
  • 40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER certification or ability to obtain this training.
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Ability and willingness to work as a team with one other full-time technician to facilitate uninterrupted operation of remediation systems by working alternating 8-day shifts, 10 hours per day, 365 days per year. Alternatively, 4-day work shifts (Friday – Monday) may be considered.
  • Willingness to remotely monitor remediation system operating conditions and to receive and periodically respond to after-hours automated system alarms during designated work shifts.
  • Reside within 30 minutes of Magnolia, Arkansas or have a willingness to relocate.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook), data management systems and ability to operate Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems.
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude and ability to apply basic mechanical principles.
  • Ability to lift 30 pounds and perform physical tasks (bending, kneeling, and walking on uneven terrain).
  • Ability to operate light landscaping equipment (weed whacker, zero turn lawn mower, push mower, backpack sprayer, shovel, and rake), a utility task vehicle (UTV), and all-terrain telehandler forklift.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively within a team.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Senior Element Management Systems Developer (34153)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a Senior Element management System (EMS) developer who will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing and maintaining EMS.
Main Responsibilities
•    Analyze requirements and design EMS FCAP applications to configure, monitor and manage network elements
•    Work closely with vendors to evaluate and implement new EMS solutions and stay up to date with industry trends.
•    Review and approve design and development solution documents, internal and external test strategies, plans, test cases and scripts.
•    Develop and maintain accurate and up to date documentation of EMS requirements, configurations, processes and procedures.
•    Design, Develop, test and maintain Yang modules to implement resource and service management
•    Implement real time network monitoring solutions to proactively identify and resolve network issues, minimizing downtime.
•    Investigate and resolve complex implementation and network problems, collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement effective solutions.
•    Develop and maintain automated test cases to verify element management functions.
•    Implement and enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity.
Education and Experience Required
•    Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
•    5-10 years of experience in a similar role.
•    Solid programming experience in python and C++17 in Linux environment
•    Solid knowledge of modelling languages such as YANG 1.1, UML is a must
•    Hands-on experience in developing application with gRPC, gNMI, gNOI, mTLS protocols
•    Working knowledge with docker, docker compose and containerized applications in embedded systems
•    Working experience in one of EMS/NMS tools and platforms such as Calian CMP, Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet
•    Knowledge in Carrier Ethernet technologies, standards, and protocols.
•    Familiarity with TMForum Open Digital Architecture (ODA), Process Framework (eTOM), TMForum APIs, is a plus
•    Familiarity with Model-based systems engineering (MBSE) is an asset.
•    Knowledge of MEF Lifecycle Service Orchestration (MEF LSO APIs) framework is an asset

job.title: Southeast Regional Sales Representative (34128)
job.description:
Job Title: Regional Sales Representative
Job Type: Direct Hire
Location: 100% Remote in Virginia, Tennessee, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, Florida
Travel: Up to 25% to visit clients and attend meetings
Base Salary: $95,000- $100,000 + commission
Company Overview
A manufacturer and installer of industrial spiral and tunnel freezer systems serving food manufacturers and processors across multiple markets. The company provides freezing solutions designed to improve operational efficiency, product quality, and production capacity.
Position Summary
This role is responsible for selling capital equipment, specifically large industrial freezer systems, to food manufacturers across the Southeast. The Regional Sales Representative will receive inbound leads and manage an existing book of business, serving as the primary point of contact for customers looking to expand or improve their freezing operations.
Approximately 65% of the role focuses on growing existing accounts and converting inbound leads while maintaining strong relationships through regular client meetings, on-site visits, and facility tours. The remaining 35% focuses on new business development, including generating new leads through cold calls and networking events.
The representative assesses customer needs, prepares quotes and proposals, and guides customers through the buying process while coordinating with internal engineering, project management, and production teams. The role also includes tracking activity in a CRM and meeting assigned sales targets.
Key Responsibilities
  • Identify and engage food manufacturing facilities and processing plants
  • Build relationships with plant leadership and purchasing decision-makers
  • Assess customer needs related to freezing capacity and production requirements
  • Recommend appropriate industrial freezer solutions
  • Prepare quotes and proposals and guide customers through the buying process
  • Coordinate with internal engineering, project management, and production teams
  • Track leads, opportunities, and customer interactions in a CRM system
  • Travel to customer sites and job locations as needed
  • Close sales and meet performance targets
Qualifications
  • High school diploma (minimum)
  • 10–15 years of sales experience
  • Experience in B2B or capital equipment sales (food processing equipment preferred)
  • Familiarity with food manufacturing or industrial processing environments
  • Strong communication, negotiation, and technical sales skills
  • Ability to manage long sales cycles and multiple opportunities
  • Self-motivated with strong organizational and time-management skills
  • Proficiency with standard business software and CRM tools
  • Willingness to travel up to 25%

job.title: Senior Database Administrator (33988)
job.description:
Our Ottawa based client in the Finance industry is looking for Senior SECRET security Cleared Database Administrator to support enterprise storage and database services across on-prem and Azure cloud environments. The Consultant will install, configure, maintain, secure, and optimize database platforms while providing operational support and resolving complex technical issues.

Key Responsibilities

  • Install, configure, and maintain Oracle Database and Microsoft SQL Server (on-prem and Azure cloud HA environments).

  • Perform database performance tuning, analysis, and monitoring.

  • Implement and maintain backup/recovery strategies (RMAN, point-in-time recovery).

  • Execute database security administration and ensure authorized data access.

  • Maintain schema objects and support production migrations.

  • Ensure data consistency and adherence to data model standards.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve database technical issues, including complex escalations.

  • Support and collaborate with existing DBA teams.

  • Deliver additional related tasks as required.

Required Technical Experience (Minimum 5+ Years)

Recent hands-on experience with:

  • Azure SQL & Azure SQL Managed Instance (MI)

  • Oracle Exadata deployed in Azure environments

  • Oracle 19c and SQL Server 2019+

  • Cloud SQL PaaS services (Azure)

  • Oracle Exadata Database Service

  • PostgreSQL on Azure

  • Oracle Exadata, Data Guard, RAC

  • RMAN (backup, restore, PITR)

  • Data Pump (database/data migration)

  • Oracle TDE (Transparent Data Encryption)

Additional Considered Qualifications

  • Experience with Oracle Autonomous Database

  • Knowledge of Commvault

  • Knowledge of Dynatrace

  • Certifications such as:

    • Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate

    • Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate

    • Oracle Cloud certifications

    • OCP or equivalent

Equipment & Access Requirem

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (3 Positions) (34281)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Part-Time AR Specialist (33322)
job.description:
Job Title: Part-Time Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist

Location: Wood Dale, IL (on-site initially; hybrid option available after approximately 2 months)
Duration: 3 months with potential for extension
Schedule: Part-time (approximately 20–22 hours per week)
Pay Rate: Competitive hourly rate, commensurate with experience

Job Summary

The Temporary Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist will support day-to-day accounting operations with a primary focus on invoicing, cash application, and collections. This role plays a key part in ensuring accurate and timely processing of customer payments, maintaining current receivables records, and assisting with month-end close and reporting. The position is designed to support increased workload and will work closely with both finance and sales teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Generate and distribute customer invoices accurately and on time through the company’s ERP system

  • Record and apply incoming payments (checks, ACH, credit cards) to customer accounts

  • Monitor accounts receivable aging and follow up on outstanding balances

  • Communicate with customers to resolve billing discrepancies, payment delays, or credit issues

  • Process credit memos, adjustments, and account reconciliations

  • Assist with month-end and year-end close activities, including AR-related journal entries

  • Prepare and maintain AR reports for management review

  • Ensure compliance with company policies and maintain proper documentation

  • Provide general accounting and administrative support as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent experience preferred

  • Minimum of 2 years of accounts receivable or general accounting experience

  • Experience in a manufacturing or similar environment preferred

  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills; ERP system experience strongly preferred

  • Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a customer-service mindset

  • High level of professionalism, integrity, and ability to work collaboratively

job.title: .NET (C#) Full Stack Developer - Azure (33384)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled .NET (C#) Full-Stack Developer to design, build, and support modern, cloud-native applications within a Microsoft Azure environment. This role requires a strong hands-on developer with experience across backend services, front-end user interfaces, and cloud infrastructure, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and high-performing solutions.

Key Responsibilities
  • Design, develop, and maintain full-stack applications using C#, .NET / .NET Core, and modern front-end frameworks
  • Build and consume RESTful APIs and backend services, ensuring performance, scalability, and security
  • Develop responsive and user-friendly front-end components using Angular, React, or similar frameworks, along with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Implement cloud-native solutions leveraging Microsoft Azure services, including App Services, Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Azure SQL / Cosmos DB, Storage Accounts, and Service Bus
  • Collaborate with architects and DevOps teams on cloud architecture, CI/CD pipelines, and deployment strategies using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions
  • Write clean, testable, and maintainable code following best practices, coding standards, and design patterns
  • Participate in code reviews, design discussions, and technical problem-solving across the development lifecycle
  • Support application troubleshooting, performance tuning, and production support as required
  • Work in an Agile/Scrum environment, contributing to sprint planning, estimations, and continuous improvement

Required Skills & Experience
  • Strong hands-on experience with C# and .NET / .NET Core in full-stack application development
  • Proven experience building front-end applications using Angular, React, or comparable frameworks
  • Solid experience working in Microsoft Azure cloud environments
  • Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., Azure SQL, SQL Server, Cosmos DB)
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, source control (Git), and automated build/deployment processes
  • Understanding of cloud security, authentication/authorization, and application monitoring/logging

Nice to Have
  • Experience with microservices architecture
  • Exposure to containerization (Docker, Kubernetes / AKS)
  • Experience with API security (OAuth2, OpenID Connect, Azure AD)
  • Background working in enterprise-scale or regulated environments

job.title: HVAC and Refrigeration Technician II (33144)
job.description:
HVAC and Refrigeration Technician
Greensburg, IN (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental and 401(k)
Pay Range: $30.00 /hr. - USD $33.00 /hr.

Summary:
As the HVAC and Refrigeration Technician, you’ll join a collaborative team ensuring that our clients can deliver their services – uninterrupted. Based in Greensburg, IN., you’ll you will prioritize repairs and complete required PM’s on facility equipment.

Responsibilities:
  • Performs preventative maintenance tasking on all HVACR equipment.
  • Starts systems, observes operation, read gauges and instruments, and adjusts mechanisms.
  • Screws, bolts, rivets, welds, and brazes parts to assemble structural and functional components such as motors, controls, switches, gauges, wiring harnesses, valves, pumps, compressors, condensers, cores, and pipes.
  • Discuss system malfunctions with users to isolate problems. Installs wiring to connect components to electric power source.
  • Lubricates fans, motors, and control units. Replaces defective/worn parts.
  • Troubleshoots, repairs, and maintains equipment.
  • Must be able to complete PM and work order activity in CMMS.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of experience in HVAC and Refrigeration maintenance and repair in a facility/plant environment.
  • Must have a Universal EPA/Refrigerant License.
  • Perform Heating, Cooling, Exhaust Fan PMs.
  • Troubleshoot, repair, maintain all HVAC equipment.
  • Self-starter, prioritize work orders based on deadlines and equipment issues.
  • Ability to read & understand system blueprints, specifications, performance data.
  • Ability to use electrical meter, megger, amp clamps. 480V and below systems.
  • Ability to cut, thread, weld, braze mechanical piping.
  • Ability to learn all FAC equipment.
  • Respond to equipment downtime.
  • Responsible to 5S & COP all areas including desk, worksite, tools, FAC spaces.
  • Driver’s license
  • Experience with the following types of equipment: HVACR, Air Compressors, Pump and Plumbing Maintenance, Basic Electrical and Mechanical Skills are required.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Senior RF Test Engineer (33471)
job.description:
The Senior RF Test Engineer will be responsible for developing and maintaining system verification and validation plans of the communication system. In addition, they will participate in the various testing activities across systems with vendors and other partners and responsible for maintaining the lab.

This position will be moved to our new Gatineau facility in 2026.
Main Responsibilities
  • In this role, the incumbent will issue recommendations and have influence on the system verification and validation.
  • Work with various Antenna Vendors to support the SOW, SRR, Test Requirements, Test Plans, Test Results and RVTM reviews, in addition to follow up on the integrate of the Antenna with the other components (Modem, and other interfaces).
  • Work with the other segments to support the development of the internal Test Plans and verification methods.
  • Support Over The Air (OTA) Test Planning and activities including the Test automation processes.
  • Support System Acceptance Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Develop system and sub system verification matrices against system requirements
  • Coordinate and participate in RF and system level testing activities including test planning, execution and reporting
  • Serve as an RF expert and support other technical staff as required
  • Plays an active role in component and subsystem design and test activities
  • Configuring test equipment like Satellite Link Emulators, signal generator, spectrum analyzer etc.
  • Ensure product under test meets technical, functional, performance and business requirements
  • Keep the lab functional and update to date with known hardware and software configuration to execute various test scenarios as necessary
  • Work with partners and other vendors in various test campaigns
Education & Experience Required
  • B. S or M.S.in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 20 years of relevant experience in satellite communications
  • 10+ years of work experience in different antenna types like Flat Panel Antenna, Parabolic and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • 10+ years of work experience in Satellite RF communication systems with strong exposure on modulation and coding used in modern standards like DVB-S2(X) and DVB-RCS2
  • Hands on experience using RF test equipment (Oscilloscopes, Signal Generators, Spectrum Analyzers, satellite channel emulator)
  • Strong understanding of RF engineering Principles and Design Practices
  • Demonstrated understanding of air interfaces, modem technologies, modulation and coding and its impact on the satellite link performance
  • Experience with satellite link budget analyses with good understanding of effects of impairments on the link performance
  • Experience in test case and defect tracking tools (Jira, Jama)
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with management, engineering teams and partners / suppliers
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with different Ka band antenna vendors
  • Experience with Flat Panel Antenna and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • Experience with BUC/LNB and various Antenna technologies
  • Experience in Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Proficient with MATLAB, python.
  • Highly collaborative team player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Salary Range - $95,000 - $135,000

job.title: Utility Worker (33967)
job.description:
Utility Worker
Rio Rancho, NM (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $18.98 /hr. - $20.98 /hr.

Responsibilities:
  • Performs routine serving and corrective maintenance of water and wastewater collection systems.
  • Cleans vehicles, heavy equipment, pumps, tools, and other stationary and portable equipment.
  • Provides routine inspections of vehicles and equipment; performs minor maintenance and lubrication of machinery such as changing oil and greasing equipment.
  • Operates and maintains vehicles, equipment and tools required to load, unload, haul and spread sand, gravel, dirt and / or waste products (sludge, product waste, packaging waste, etc.); digs and refills ditched and trenches.
  • Carries or holds materials, supplies and tools to assist operations and maintenance personnel
  • Maintains grounds and buildings; cuts grass, weeds and brush; trims trees and bushes; rakes grass, leaves and trash, seeds and cares for lawns and ornamental plantings.
  • Understand and carries out oral and written directions.
  • Works safely and adheres to established safety procedures.
  • Establishes and maintains cooperative relationships with those contacted during the course of work.
  • Ability to carry and respond to pages as requested by management.
  • Ability and willingness to work on-call shifts, as requested, including being fit and able to respond to call-ins in a timely manner.
  • Performs other duties as required.
 
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license.
  • Possess a valid Class A CDL with Tanker endorsement.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. job.title: Guidewire Technical Lead (34235)
job.description:
Our insurance-sector client is seeking a Guidewire Technical Leads for a long term contract- remote. The successful candidate will provide staff augmentation and support their Guidewire platform across PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, and ClaimCenter.

Responsibilities

  • Develop solutions using Guidewire InsuranceSuite (PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, ClaimCenter).

  • Implement workflows, rules, data models, and UI components (PCFs).

  • Integrate Guidewire with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs.

  • Conduct code reviews for offshore development deliverables and provide support to unblock the team on technical issues.

  • Participate in requirements gathering and solution design with client stakeholders.

  • Provide technical support and troubleshoot issues during implementation.

  • Ensure solutions align with business goals and insurance processes.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience designing and delivering solutions with Guidewire PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, and ClaimCenter.

  • Strong experience integrating Guidewire with external systems via REST and SOAP APIs.

  • Experience conducting code reviews and mentoring offshore development teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to participate in requirements and solution design sessions, aligning technical solutions with client business and insurance processes.

job.title: Systems Engineer (33469)
job.description:
As a Systems Engineer, you will help lead the technical direction. You will contribute to the development and integration of sophisticated algorithms, guide performance assessments, and influence architectural decisions that drive the success of the constellation. You will also mentor engineering teams and collaborate across departments to ensure technical alignment with system requirements and seamless integrations.
Main Responsibilities
  • Take ownership of the design, development, and validation of advanced algorithms in MATLAB to optimize system performance and reliability while meeting system requirements.
  • Oversee performance analysis of our clients product, including throughput, latency, satellite handover, availability, capacity, and regulatory compliance metrics.
  • Drive cross-functional collaboration with System Modeling, Software Development, Quality Assurance, and System Engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and testing.
  • Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior engineers, fostering innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Interface with other teams regarding topics such as satellite payload and ground segment characteristics, definitions of performance metrics, performance evaluations, and regulatory compliance.
  • Lead trade-off studies and system architecture evaluations, contributing to long-term planning and system evolution.
  • Author and review high-quality technical documentation.
  • Follow Agile software development methodologies.
  • Ensure code quality through unit testing, refactoring, and adherence to coding standards.
Education and Experience Required
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, System Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in related system design and modeling roles, with a minimum of 10 years in similar roles.
  • Strong understanding of software development lifecycle, Agile methodologies, and CI/CD tools.
  • Proven expertise in MATLAB and algorithm development.
  • Experience with Java is an asset.
  • Experience with HPC environments and cluster job managers is an asset.
  • Knowledge of radio communication systems and/or satellite communication is desirable.
  • Experience in mathematical optimization including linear programming is desirable.
Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Creative problem-solver with thorough attention to detail.
  • Highly collaborative team-player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder engagement skills.
  • Ability to prioritize opportunities, needs and resources
  • An aptitude for and interest in complex technology
  • Fluent in English, written and oral. French is an asse
Salary Range $115,000 - $145,000

job.title: UX Designer (33633)
job.description:
• Leads discovery activities to understand users, define audience segments, and map end-to-end customer journeys that inform product strategy.

  • Conducts qualitative and quantitative research (interviews, usability sessions, behavioral studies) to surface user needs, pain points, and opportunity areas.

  • Translates research findings into actionable artifacts such as personas, journey maps, workflow diagrams, and experience recommendations.

  • Evaluates existing digital products—especially B2B applications—to identify UX gaps, workflow friction, and optimization opportunities.

  • Applies Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) principles to ensure intuitive interaction patterns and user-centred design decisions.

  • Leverages analytics and research tools (e.g., GA4, Hotjar, insight platforms) to validate assumptions, detect behavioral patterns, and support data-driven decisions.

  • Uses collaborative design tools (Figma, Miro, etc.) to prototype concepts, facilitate workshops, and guide cross-functional teams through ideation and solutioning.

  • Communicates research insights, concepts, and design rationale clearly to stakeholders to ensure shared alignment across discovery and delivery phases.

  • Partners with marketing/brand teams to incorporate visual identity and brand expression into user experiences.

  • Synthesizes complex data into clear experience frameworks, demonstrating creativity, strong organization, and attention to detail while staying current with UX industry practices.

job.title: Deployment Lead (33519)
job.description:
Our Client is undergoing a major banking technology implementation and requires an experienced Deployment Lead to drive and execute deployment activities across multiple phases. This role ensures smooth production and non-production event coordination, environment readiness, and cross-team alignment.

Responsibilities

  • Lead deployment planning and execution for large-scale technology initiatives.

  • Manage complex schedules, plans, and readiness activities.

  • Oversee production and non-production events, including extended or weekend hours when required.

  • Coordinate cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Ensure environment management activities and transitions run smoothly.

  • Identify risks, dependencies, and gaps; escalate and resolve issues promptly.

  • Support all major practice and production events throughout the project lifecycle.

Skills & Competencies

Technical & Organizational

  • Strong organizational discipline managing complex deployment plans.

  • Ability to rapidly learn new systems, tools, and processes.

  • Excellent collaboration with technical and business teams.

  • Flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced environment.

Soft Skills

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to problem-solve under pressure.

  • Proven leadership during critical deployment phases.

  • Proactive, resilient, and steady under stress.

Required Experience

  • Project management experience within large-scale technology implementations.

  • Direct experience leading deployment, environment readiness, and production/non-production events.

  • Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams in high-pressure environments.

  • Strong background in environment management and deployment readiness planning.

job.title: Senior Embedded Developer - Principal (32925)
job.description:
Principal Embedded Software Developer will play a pivotal role in driving the architectural and design aspects of our software projects.
They will collaborate closely with System Engineering and other cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with our organizational objectives and be a technical lead within the Scrum Team, guiding and influencing the team's decisions to achieve optimal outcomes. In addition, they will lead technical discussions with our valued vendors and partners, fostering strong relationships and provide vital day-to-day guidance to team members, promoting a cohesive and productive work environment.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of embedded application software, board support software and OS integration
    • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define architecture, technical specifications, and software requirements for ground segment systems.
    • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the engineering team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
    • Architect software solutions that adhere to Test-Driven Development (TDD) principles and utilize simulated software to rigorously test code functionality.
    • Design software with a profound understanding of hardware resource limitations to ensure optimal performance in resource-constrained environments.
    • Stay current with the latest advancements in satellite technology and industry trends, driving innovation and maintaining technical excellence.
    • Implement and support MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Guide the team in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of ground segment software.
    • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.

job.title: Mechanical Superintendent (33361)
job.description:
Mechanical Superintendent 
Livermore , CA (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $60.00 - $70.00

Description:
The Mechanical Superintendent is responsible for field operations on the assigned project(s) in order to achieve safe, timely and profitable completion of each project. Plans, organizes, and supervises specific portions of construction work for an assigned area of a construction project. 

Responsibilities: 
  • Responsible for the oversight of the following project work activities: piping (carbon, stainless steel, and alloy), rotating equipment, stationary equipment, structural steel, rigging, piping and structural welding, insulation and heat tracing, hydrostatic testing, non-destructive examination techniques, fire protection, and coatings.
  • Responsible for overall supervision of construction effort, which includes: safety, productivity of crafts, efficient use of materials and equipment, materials management, scheduling, engineering, and contractual performance of the project.
  • Responsible for subcontractor contractual compliance on designated mechanical construction related activities.
  • Build effective client and subcontractor relationships.  Interface with client representatives, A/E representatives, and other contractors.
  • Collaborate with project management to develop and implement project procedures, working documents, and standards.
  • Authorize purchase requisitions, field design change requests, etc., under supervision of Construction Manager and Project Manager.
  • Responsible for overall project safety.  Reviews and audits site specific safety documentation, including Pre-Task Analysis (PTAs) and Task Safety Observations (TSOs) on a regular basis.
  • Complete daily field reports and take daily pictures to document construction progress.
  • Assess future work activities and identify any concerns with work plans by utilizing subcontractors 3-week look ahead report.
  • Develop a marked-up and as-built set of drawings to produce the record set documents, and answer RFIs with assistance from Assistant Project Manager or Field Engineer.
  • Direct and manage subcontractor as necessary to comply with the established project schedule, and track and verify progress on an installed quantity and work hour basis.
  • Verify material deliveries meet specifications and are being stored properly, and required preventative maintenance and/or temporary heating is being performed by the subcontractor (this potentially is coordinated with the Materials Manager).
  • Coordinate with the QA/QC Manager to verify all welders on site are qualified to weld on the project.
  • Witness all equipment setting and alignment.
  • Walk down all systems prior to, during, and post hydrostatic testing to verify compliance with drawings and specifications and signing off on completed system testing and restoration.
  • Develop punch lists of items out of compliance or not completed.
  • Verify the most current drawing revisions are being used in the field.
  • Understand and execute the project scope and any changes that develop. Ensure field change orders are executed.
  • Oversee craft supervision and project staffing as required.
  • Provide oversight of project site material and tool management.
  • Responsible for the daily field construction of an individual project in accordance with the established policies, procedures, systems, and requirements approved by the company.
  • Supervises and directs the daily efforts of the physical construction of the project through daily coordination of all field activities, subcontractor direction, and code/specification compliance.
  • Read, interpret, and understand isometric drawings, structural drawings, and P&ID's.
  • Performs other duties as assigned
  • Complies with all policies and standards
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree and 7 years construction management experience or craft supervision experience on Mechanical projects; Required – OR – Associate Degree and 9 years construction management experience or craft supervision experience on Mechanical projects; Required – OR – High School Diploma/GED and 11 years construction management experience or craft supervision experience on Mechanical projects; Required 
  • Must have excellent communication skills, strong leadership skills, and a strong safety background. 
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Suite. 
  • Must be able to meet company's driving requirements 


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant (34053)
job.description:
Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant
STSI is looking for a Cyber Security Consultant who is detail oriented with a willingness to utilize their investigative mind and dig into remediation issues, conduct security audits, and implement change plans in IT & OT environments. Ideal candidates have experience assessing security and PLC controls with experience conducting security audits, maintaining up to date understanding of guidance from the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), and have a firm understanding and experience with Allen Bradley PLC and Modbus PLC universal communication protocol.

Type: Full-time Contract - W2 ONLY, accepting candidate that are a US Citizen (nonnegotiable)
Compensation: $ 50.00 USD to 60.00 USD
# of Positions: 3-5
Location: Richmond, VA and Glen Allen, VA
Travel: 80% - 100% - accepting only local candidates in the state of Virginia who are able to drive/go to different locations/offices in VA. Consultants will use their own vehicle and must have a valid driver's license.
Expense: Miles, Hotel (when required), food are reimbursed expenses.
Schedule: Daylight, Monday through Friday.
Reports to: Director of Network & Endpoint Security, Project Manager & Delivery Lead

Position Summary:
The Cybersecurity Consultant will independently execute significant portions of projects addressing Information Technology (IT) and Industrial Control System security. The Cybersecurity Consultant supports the execution of projects consisting of network penetration testing, web application security testing, cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, secure system design and integration, and/or development of cybersecurity programs at client sites across the U.S and Canada utilizing the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF), and other industry or data specific compliance frameworks and regulations. Execute the planning, design, development and implementation of technical controls, procedures and policy associated with cybersecurity compliance and/or regulatory standards.


Responsibilities:
  • Maintain highest level of integrity, protecting the confidentiality and security of all clients and project information.
  • Identify and diagnose operational issues and implement design alterations to address these issues.
  • Conduct network penetration tests and vulnerability assessments of IT and Operational Technology (OT) networks, for both compliance and security purposes.
  • Perform detailed, post event analysis of unusual events, and direct needed procedure or process changes in response.
  • Pursue, obtain, and maintain industry recognized IT certifications related to cybersecurity such as ethical hacking, network engineering, Industrial Control System (ICS), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA), risk management, and others as necessary.
  • Resolve technical issues, analyze implications to the client's business, and be able to communicate them with applicable stakeholders within the business.
  • Develop policies & procedures for secure process control network design, technical and design recommendations for the implementation of firewalls and other network security and compliance controls.
  • Compiles technical documentation of network traffic as well as firewall services/solutions including explanations and diagrams.
  • Work collaboratively with other groups and divisions inside the company.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Comply with all policies and standards.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field and min 3 years of related/relevant experience is Required.
  • Advanced knowledge of security principles and firm knowledge of cybersecurity technologies, as well as industry-recognized certifications.
  • Experience with cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and the tools/techniques involved in both.
  • Experience in the capabilities and/or configuration of cybersecurity controls, specifically those relating to firewalls, access control, authentication, anti-virus/anti-malware, patching, and logging.
  • Advanced knowledge of control systems utilized by utilities, manufacturing, oil and gas, transportation, smart buildings, and cities.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Ability to operate under pressure and under tight deadlines, to operate in on-site industrial, corporate, and government work.
  • Demonstrate capability to make sound decisions based on good security practices and principles.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of business principles and operational security practices specific to engineering and/or security consulting.
  • Knowledge and/or experience with corporate policies and procedures.
  • Strong technical writing skills. Knowledge and experience with modern and legacy computer networking and telecommunications.
  • Experience with physical cabling for network communications and control system Input/Output.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain access to current and future client sites.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

We’re targeting a Senior-to-Director-level professional—someone capable of shaping strategy and driving results across multiple teams and geographies. The ideal candidate brings strong autonomy, strategic judgement, and exceptional executive-level communication and influence skills. A minimum of  8+ years of banking/banking domain and architecture experience and 12+ years of overall industry experience is required.

job.title: Senior RF Systems Engineer (33470)
job.description:
Senior RF Systems Engineering Specialist – Satellite Communications

This role requires deep technical expertise in satellite RF communications, with a strong focus on physical layer and Layer 2 system design. A solid working knowledge of Layer 3 and higher protocols is also expected. The successful candidate will bring extensive experience with DVB-S2, DVB-S2X, and DVB-RCS2 standards, along with a strong foundation in RF and digital communications theory.

You will have hands-on experience with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) techniques and a strong understanding of modern antenna technologies, including active and phased array systems. This includes digital beamforming, rapid beam hopping, and antenna performance modelling. The role operates within a systems engineering framework, requiring familiarity with requirements management and the full lifecycle from concept through verification.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze and review RF link budgets, conduct system-level trade studies, and model signal impairments to evaluate overall communications performance.

  • Collaborate closely with system architects, RF, antenna, and earth station engineers to allocate functionality between hardware and software while optimizing system performance.

  • Develop and maintain high-level requirements and specifications for RF links, RF subsystems, and antenna systems, including managing requirement updates as designs evolve.

  • Define, review, and assess test plans, procedures, and results to verify compliance with system specifications.

  • Perform system performance characterization and analysis, maintaining detailed performance budgets for assigned system elements.

  • Provide technical expertise in support of regulatory, spectrum coordination, and market access activities.

  • Mentor junior engineers and serve as a technical resource for team members with developing domain expertise.

  • Prepare and deliver technical presentations to internal and external engineering audiences as required.

Education and Experience

  • Master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, with a focus on RF, antenna and microwave engineering, digital communications, or digital signal processing.

  • Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience performing system-level RF or satellite communications engineering.

  • Proven experience with digital communication systems, including spread-spectrum and single- and multi-carrier architectures.

  • Strong background in modulation schemes such as PSK, APSK, and QAM.

  • Direct experience with DVB-S2X, DVB-RCS2, and Adaptive Coding and Modulation techniques.

  • Demonstrated capability in modelling RF communication systems using advanced tools such as MATLAB, Python, or equivalent environments.

Skills and Competencies

  • Strong collaborator who performs effectively in cross-functional engineering teams.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • High standards for technical quality, accuracy, and documentation.

  • Capable of managing multiple complex technical challenges concurrently.

If you want, I can also:

  • Make it more concise

  • Adjust the tone (more corporate, more technical, or more startup-style)

  • Reformat it for LinkedIn, an RFP, or a careers page


    Salary Range - $110,000 - $140,000

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34282)

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

job.title: SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) (34049)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of an SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) for a 12++ month contract with the potential for hire.  This is an On-Site role in Grand Rapids, MI.  The skills required are below:

12 Months
$80/hr BR

SAP Technical Analyst - onsite in Grand Rapids, MI full time 

Technical Analyst
We are looking for a technical analyst with primarily SAP S/4 experience to contribute to the objectives of our global team and its ongoing projects. In this role, you will apply Agile methodologies to facilitate the efficient delivery of robust SAP S/4 technical solutions that advance cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
The team you will be part of    
 
We are a global team managing the migration from SAP ECC to S/4 to support manufacturing, distribution, and logistics. Our versatile members ensure smooth transition and ongoing ECC technical support, working collaboratively to achieve team objectives and align with company goals.
 
Primary Responsibilities
 
As a technical analyst, your responsibilities will include:
·         Interpreting functional specifications and translating them into implementable and supportable technical solutions

job.title: ASIC Design Engineer (34011)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior ASIC Design Engineer to join a high-performance hardware development team. This role involves end-to-end ASIC design, from micro-architecture definition through implementation and debug, supporting advanced high-speed communication systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define micro-architecture and contribute to system-level ASIC design decisions

  • Implement and verify complex digital logic for high-performance ASICs

  • Debug functional, timing, and integration issues across the design lifecycle

  • Collaborate closely with architecture, verification, physical design, and system teams

  • Support design reviews, documentation, and design sign-off activities

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of design methodologies and tools

Required Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering; advanced degree preferred

  • Minimum of 10 years of hands-on ASIC design experience

  • Strong skills in micro-architecture, RTL design, and design debugging

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Solid understanding of the full ASIC design flow and associated EDA tools

  • Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment

Preferred Qualifications / Assets

  • Design experience supporting Ethernet standards from 100G through 800G

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (33597)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

Education Requirements:

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience


    Salary Range:  $130,000 - $260,000

job.title: Construction Project Manager, RenewableProjects (34243)
job.description:
Construction Project Manager, Renewable Projects

Schaumburg, IL (On-site)
Benefits: Access to Client Full Benefits Package 
Pay Range: $145-160K 

Summary:

The Construction Project Manager will lead planning, coordination, and execution of utility-scale renewable (solar, wind, battery storage) and thermal (natural gas or combined cycle) power projects.  The role oversees pre-construction development and planning, EPC contract management, reporting, safety compliance, schedule performance, and budget adherence to ensure successful project delivery from pre-construction through commissioning.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage construction activities for renewable and thermal generation projects, ensuring scope, schedule, cost, and quality targets are met.
  • Coordinate with development, engineering, procurement, and finance teams to transition projects from development to construction.
  • Oversee EPC and subcontractor performance, ensuring compliance with contractual, technical, and safety requirements.
  • Lead site mobilization, logistics, and construction sequencing in alignment with project milestones.
  • Develop and track detailed project schedules using Primavera P6 or MS Project.
  • Manage RFIs, change orders, and progress payments in collaboration with the project controls team.
  • Lead regular progress meetings, issue tracking, and reporting to senior management and project stakeholders.
  • Support grid interconnection activities and testing/commissioning in coordination with utilities and ISO representatives.
  • Facilitate turnover to operations and maintenance teams upon project completion.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil/Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or related field.
  • 6+ years managing utility-scale energy construction projects, including both renewable and thermal generation.
  • Strong knowledge of EPC contract management and project delivery methods
  • Proficiency in project scheduling and cost control software (Primavera P6, MS Project, Excel).
  • Demonstrated understanding of grid interconnection, commissioning, and QA/QC processes.
  • Experience with environmental and permitting compliance during construction phases.
  • Excellent leadership, problem solving, communication, and organizational skills.
  • Experience with both fossil and renewable generation plant construction would be a plus
  • Familiarity with ERCOT or ISO project interconnection and testing requirements preferred
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license or PMP certification would be a plus, but not required
  • Experience in contract negotiation and claims management.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and site teams concurrently.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s
Pay: $22 per hour on W2 
Hours:  Monday-Friday, 40hrs. 7am-3:30pm
Location: Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only

Lab Assistant

What is special about this role:
As an onsite laboratory assistant, this role’s primary responsibility is to conduct lab glassware washing, stock lab supplies, dispose of chemical waste, and maintain overall chemical quality control cleanliness. Other responsibilities include login of samples into QA systems and some wet chem testing. Candidate should be detail-oriented, able to identify work needed, and organized to ensure compliance and safety. This role communicates regularly with chemistry lab scientists, so good communication, professionalism, and kindness are a must.
 
Roles and Responsibilities:
  • Glassware, pipette, and lab equipment dishwashing
  • Login of Nutrilite Spaulding Plant products into controlled inventory system
  • Maintenance of retains
  • Stocking glassware and lab supplies
  • Remove and dispose of expired reagents
  • Stocking kitchenette food and drink supplies
  • Lab bench and equipment cleaning
  • Weekly check of eye wash and safety showers
  • Disposal of product waste
  • Physical testing of softgels & tablets including weights, peroxide value, disintegration time, etc.
  • Fluoride testing for toothpaste.
 
Skills to be Successful:
  • Attention to detail to follow standard operating procedures, safety requirements, and current good manufacturing practices (cGMP)
  • A love to learn attitude
  • Works effectively in a fast-paced team laboratory environment
  • Must demonstrate flexibility /agility and engagement in a changing environment
  • Positive attitude and strong work ethic

job.title: Project Manager – E-Commerce & Systems Integration (Part-Time Contract) (33714)
job.description:
Overview

Our client, a Professional Services organization, is seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead client-facing initiatives focused on e-commerce and enterprise system integrations. The Project Manager will serve as the primary liaison between project teams, account teams, and client stakeholders, taking full ownership of delivery from initiation through closeout.

This role requires a strong balance of client relationship management, financial accountability, and hands-on delivery leadership within a consulting environment. The engagement is part-time / half-time, averaging approximately 20 hours per week, and is ideal for a Project Manager comfortable operating in a flexible consulting model while maintaining high standards of execution and accountability.

Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the face of the project to the client, building trust through clear communication, effective meeting facilitation, and proactive issue management
  • Manage the full project lifecycle from initiation to closeout, ensuring delivery on time, within scope, and within approved budgets
  • Own project financials, forecasting, margin performance, and status reporting, ensuring alignment to contractual and internal performance metrics
  • Manage project resources and make informed trade-offs between scope, quality, time, and cost
  • Partner with Pre-Sales teams and Delivery Leads to support project scoping, SOW development, and change request management
  • Author and maintain all required project documentation, dashboards, and tracking artifacts aligned to Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid delivery models
  • Proactively identify, track, and mitigate risks related to scope, budget, resourcing, and delivery, escalating as required
  • Lead project governance, including steering committee meetings, executive reporting, cost/revenue forecasting, and customer budget updates
  • Establish success metrics, KPIs, and delivery milestones at project kickoff and oversee progress through completion
  • Oversee project closeout activities, including final financials, value realization, and lessons learned / retrospectives
  • Ensure appropriate resource allocation, time tracking, and utilization throughout the project lifecycle
  • Support delivery teams with complex decision-making and conflict resolution when required
  • Monitor project team performance in collaboration with Delivery Leads and Functional Managers, providing feedback and setting expectations
  • Drive adoption of Agile delivery practices, including Scrum and SAFe, where applicable
  • Identify opportunities to expand existing client engagements and support account growth through trusted client relationships
  • Travel to client sites as required for key milestones such as kickoffs, steering committees, or major delivery events

Required Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience as a Project Manager within e-commerce, digital commerce, product data, supply chain, or consulting environments
  • Proven experience delivering projects in a Professional Services or consulting organization, supporting external client engagements
  • Strong understanding of software and system integrations, including APIs, middleware, and system-to-system data flows
  • Experience managing projects involving e-commerce platforms, ERP systems, PIM/MDM, OMS, or supply chain technologies
  • Demonstrated success delivering multiple concurrent projects or programs, including large-scale or complex initiatives
  • Hands-on experience with Agile, Scrum, SAFe, Kanban, Waterfall, or hybrid delivery methodologies
  • Experience using DevOps and delivery tools such as Jira, Azure DevOps (ADO), or similar platforms
  • Proven ability to manage, forecast, and control project budgets, including multi-million-dollar engagements
  • Strong client-facing communication skills with experience engaging senior executives and key stakeholders
  • Exceptional organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent documentation, reporting, and presentation skills using Google Workspace and/or Microsoft Office

Nice to Have
  • Experience with complex data migrations and Master Data Management (MDM) concepts
  • Familiarity with MDM and PIM tools (e.g., STIBO, Informatica, Syndigo, Precisely/EnterWorks)
  • Experience implementing e-commerce platforms such as SAP Commerce, Shopify, Spryker, VTEX, or similar
  • Experience with fulfillment or supply chain platforms (e.g., Fluent or related technologies)
  • Comfort working in a part-time / fractional delivery capacity (~20 hours per week)

Engagement Details
  • Engagement Type: Contract / Consulting
  • Workload: Part-time / Half-time (approximately 20 hours per week)
  • Delivery Model: Remote with occasional client-site travel as required
  • Duration: Project-based, with potential for extension

job.title: QA Sampler (33611)
job.description:
Job Title: QA Sampler
Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We cannot accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.
Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s
Pay: $19 per hour on W2 
Location: Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only

Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of  a QA Sampler for a 6 months contract with the potential to go 3 years or perm. This is an ON-SITE role.  

Description:
The sampling position would include sampling all raw material and packaging components in several warehouses. The raw material sampling would include materials that are used in the cosmetic and home care products as well as materials that are used in the food industry including allergens. The packaging components would be sampled in the warehouse and this would include inspecting the shipment for defective components.

The materials that are sampled are logged in the QA data system where sampling data is entered. The samples are then delivered to the respective labs including micro, chemistry and packaging. This is NOT a QA laboratory job but may lead to opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Requirements:
- A valid State of Michigan driver’s license. Candidate will be driving around complex.
- Basic computer skills.
- Science background or science degree is preferred but not required.
- Raw material samplers must wear shoes with full leather uppers.

job.title: Business Architect / Consultant – Digital Commerce & Manufacturing (34297)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Business Architect/Consultant with a strong understanding of the Industrial Manufacturing sector. This role plays a key part in helping our clients recognize the value of their partnership with us—acting as a strategic advisor across B2B, B2C/DTC Commerce, PIM, Supply Chain, and Marketplace initiatives.

Role Overview
The Business Architect/Consultant works at the intersection of business strategy and digital commerce execution. You will guide clients through discovery, define future-state solutions, support implementation teams, and serve as a trusted thought partner who brings clarity, structure, and industry insight to complex challenges.

Key Responsibilities
Discovery & Engagement Leadership
  • Support the leadership of client engagements by driving discovery activities and shaping the strategic direction.
  • Conduct structured workshops (requirements gathering, current-state analysis, pain-point exploration, and future-state visioning) to extract detailed, actionable insights.
  • Convert business challenges into clearly articulated requirements, user stories, and process designs—surfacing gaps, dependencies, and risks across business and technology teams.
  • Produce high-quality discovery deliverables, including:
  • As-is and to-be process flows
  • Requirements documentation
  • User journeys, use cases, and activity diagrams
  • Integration and data considerations
  • Executive-ready summaries and recommendations
Strategic Advisory
  • Operate as a trusted advisor to senior client leaders by applying deep knowledge of Manufacturing and Digital Commerce ecosystems.
  • Provide guidance on strategic roadmaps, operating models, and modernization approaches.
  • Advise on digital commerce platform capabilities, solution components, and architectural considerations in partnership with technical architects.
  • Prepare concise decision-ready materials that help executives prioritize investments and understand business impact.
  • Assess digital commerce strategies or channels and recommend initiatives to drive measurable growth or efficiency.
Client Delivery & Implementation Support
  • Work closely with Engagement Managers/Directors to maintain scope, manage stakeholders, and ensure successful execution.
  • Ensure requirements are ready for implementation teams; validate estimates, assumptions, and solution approaches.
  • Collaborate with development and architecture teams to evaluate trade-offs between usability, performance, and technical feasibility.
  • Participate in or lead quarterly business reviews with clients to guide ongoing success and optimization.
Thought Leadership
  • Engage with industry analysts and stay current with trends in commerce, supply chain, and industrial manufacturing.
  • Create thought leadership content (articles, whitepapers, short videos/webinars) showcasing expertise in Manufacturing and Digital Commerce.
  • Represent The Company at conferences, webinars, and industry events as a subject-matter expert.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Business Architect, Solution Architect, or similar role within eCommerce or digital transformation environments.
  • Strong familiarity with the Industrial Manufacturing domain is highly preferred.
  • Proven background in eCommerce consulting—including strategy development, financial/business modeling, and competitive analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex initiatives and deliver solutions within scope, timelines, and budgets.
  • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present to C-Suite audiences and distill complex information into clear priorities.

Preferred Skills
  • Business Analysis certification (e.g., CBAP, CCBA).
  • Experience working in a consulting or professional services environment.

job.title: PingOne AIC Architect (ForgeRock Identity Cloud) (33333)

  • Support SAP-enabled revenue accounting processes, functional specs, unit testing, and client support for training/testing.

Required Experience

  • 7+ years hands-on SAP experience with large-scale S/4HANA deployments in RAR

Nice to Have

job.title: Content Marketing Writer (Product Marketing) (33663)

Duration: 10+ months contract
Work Location: Hybrid at either locations (Kennesaw GA, Riverwoods IL, Phildelphia PA).


TOP Skills:

  • Technical Proficiency: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Familiarity with basic HTML (OneWeb).

Job Summary
  • As a Content Marketing Writer - Product Marketing Specialist you will develop compelling, strategic content that fuels customer growth, engagement, and retention.
  • This role blends storytelling, demand generation focused content, journalism-inspired curiosity, and marketing program execution to help bring our product narratives to life.
  • As part of the Product Marketing organization, you will craft content that elevates our message in the market—hard hitting advertising content, newsletter articles, blog posts, product stories, customer insights, and more.
  • You will collaborate across demand generation, product marketing, product management, customer success, and retention teams to deliver high?quality content that drives revenue impact.
  • The ideal candidate is a writer through and through and having a reporter’s mindset is a plus—someone who loves digging for insights, interviewing internal experts, and turning complex topics into clear, persuasive narratives.
  • You are naturally curious, organized, and able to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Content Creation to Fuel Demand Generation & Advertising Campaigns.
  • Develop compelling copy that fuels demand generation and advertising campaigns.
  • Focus on crafting high-impact content for digital ads, landing pages, email. campaigns, and other marketing assets that attract, engage, and convert prospects.
  • Strong writing skills with an understanding of marketing strategy and audience psychology.
  • Content Development & Storytelling Write newsletter articles, blog posts, and product-focused stories based on input from subject matter experts (SMEs).
  • Conduct SME interviews to uncover insights, angles, and compelling storylines.
  • Translate technical, product, or tax/accounting concepts into approachable, engaging content.
  • Ensure content aligns with product marketing strategy and supports revenue and growth goals.
  • Content Marketing & Lifecycle Program Execution Support ongoing operations for the Account Bulletin and similar customer communication programs, including scheduling, drafting, and proofing.
  • Maintain and manage the content marketing editorial calendar.

  • Execute email marketing campaigns that support lifecycle, retention, and upsell initiatives.
  • Support content preparation for launches, promotions, newsletters, and thought?leadership moments.
  • Collaboration & Coordination Work cross?functionally with product marketing, product management, demand generation, content marketing, and customer success teams.
  • Ensure timely delivery of content and marketing materials across multiple workstreams. Track performance metrics for select content and email campaigns.

REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Exceptional Writing: Strong portfolio demonstrating high impact content, editorial skill, narrative structure, clarity, and storytelling ability.
  • Journalistic Mindset: Curious interviewer; able to extract insights and craft engaging narratives from SME conversations.
  • Marketing Fundamentals: Understanding of marketing concepts, customer lifecycle, and content strategy.
  • Project & Time Management: Ability to manage multiple deadlines with strong attention to detail.
  • Communication: Clear, proactive communicator across verbal and written channels.
  • Research Skills: Ability to gather insights, perform initial research, and produce drafts based on complex topics.
  • Technical Proficiency: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Familiarity with basic HTML (OneWeb).

Preferred:
  • Experience with marketing automation and CMS tools (Pardot and Sitecore preferred, but training available)

job.title: Junior Technical Support Analyst (33657)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in White Plains, NY, is currently seeking a Customer Service Representative for a 100% Remote contract position.

Pay Rate: $18-19/hr on W2.

Job Description:

The Customer Service Representative provides support to internal and external clients on technical and product specific issues. May provide remote technical and application support to customers, by phone, email, chat and/or remote system access. Strong knowledge of product specialty as this role demands more technical inclination than typical 1st line support. Requires ability to discern/creatively troubleshoot client issues associated with enterprise application including bespoke client networks. Requires developing strong knowledge of complex product, and clear/concise communication/documentation to client questions relating to the application.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Technical Support: Provide remote application support and troubleshooting for complex products to both internal teams and external customers.
  • Issue Resolution: Utilize strong analytical skills to identify the root cause of issues and resolve cases promptly without the need for escalation where possible (e.g., product operation or content).
  • Case Management: Maintain clear, concise, and accurate documentation of all client interactions and technical resolutions within the CRM.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work proactively with internal departments to resolve specialized procedural or operational issues, ensuring escalated cases are driven to closure.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Deliver timely updates to business owners and users regarding issue status and final resolutions.
  • Knowledge Sharing: Contribute to team knowledge bases, meetings, and documentation to help reduce recurring issues and improve overall team efficiency.
  • Professional Representation: Maintain a reputation of competence and integrity by staying current on industry trends and company product offerings.
Education:
  • Minimum: High school diploma or equivalent.

Required Skills/Experience:
  • 2 years of client-facing application support experience, including: Troubleshooting product issues, and reporting issues via phone/e-mail/chat

  • Working collaboratively with individuals at all levels of the organization
  • Executing to short and long-term plans
Technical Tools:

  • Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.
  • Technical Infrastructure: Microsoft Server products (Windows Server, SQL, MS Project).
  • Specialized Software: Visio, Microsoft Access, and BusinessObjects.

Skills & Abilities:
  • Analytical Thinking: Ability to discern and creatively troubleshoot complex enterprise application issues.
  • Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for professional presentations and technical documentation.
  • Organization: Strong prioritization and multitasking skills in a fast-paced environment.
  • Interpersonal: Excellent collaborative and conflict-resolution skills.
  • Problem Solving: Demonstrated ability to make sound decisions under pressure.

job.title: 100% Remote Sr QA Automation Engineer (W2 only) (34413)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Chicago, IL, is currently seeking a Sr QA Automation Engineer for a Remote contract position.

NOTE: Looking for W2 candidates.

Top 3 hard skills:
• Hands on experience in test automation tools like Cypress and Selenium
• Hands on experience in JavaScript/Typescript and Java
• Experience working with a cloud provider like AWS.

Top 3 soft skills:

• Experience working as a senior Quality Engineer for at least 5 years.

Job Description:
Our client is seeking a Senior Quality Engineer to drive end to end quality through close collaboration developers, product owners and other key stakeholders to deliver high-quality software products. This role requires strong ownership to define, implement and champion quality practices that ensure high-impact delivery.

Key Activities:

• Working across teams to validate end to end flows.

• Experience working as a Senior Quality Engineer for at least 5 years.
